alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 21 at 11:54PM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona, including the following area, Yuma and California, including the following areas, Chiriaco Summit, Chuckwalla Mountains, Chuckwalla Valley, Imperial County Southeast, Imperial County Southwest, Imperial County West, Imperial Valley, Joshua Tree NP East, Joshua Tree NP West and Salton Sea. * WHEN...Through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall with isolated thunderstorms will occur Friday. Moderate rainfall can be expected at times with total rainfall amounts averaging between 0.75" to 1.25" across the Watch area with locally higher amounts in thunderstorm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
